This should at least get a guard around the NPE, and maybe log the failure.

There is already a guard and the failure is logged that was added earlier. 
Lowering priority while waiting to see if this error will occur again since
it seems to be unpredictable and there is no known way to directly cause it.
If this is no longer happening just close out, otherwise investigate.

I think that the problem was that the InternalSearchUI was never initialized
before we attempted to call it, so now we make sure to call InternalSearchUI.getInstance()
before we do any Java search.
